value: a tourist destination. Formerly the base of the heavily-armed terrorist group

, the city is now in the hands of African Union peacekeepers. Yet peace has not returned, and suicide and guerrilla attacks occur near-daily. Given that this is one of the most dangerous cities in the most dangerous country in the world,
travel here by Westerners is practically suicidal!

(also Kismaayo, Kismayo and Chisimayu) is a port city in
Kismayo is a port city located around 500km south of the capital

, and has a population of around 250,000. Since the former President Siad Barre was overthrown in 1992, Kismayo has been a city in constant turmoil with local war lords, the federal government, African Union peacekeepers, Al Shabaab and others all vying for control of the area.
Buses are the main form of transportation in the city.

value: content=Small hotel with 22 rooms built in 1983, a restaurant and a mosque is available at the hotel grounds.

At present, the city can in no way be considered a tourist destination, and unaccompanied Westerners would most likely not make it out alive. Arrival by car from Mogadishu is extremely dangerous, and arriving by sea invites risk of attack by pirates.
